Abul Qasem Fazlul Huq was born in 1873 at Saturia in Barishal. He received his primary education in -a village Maktab. Then, he entered Barishal Zilla School. He passed the Entrance Examination standing first in the Dhaka Division. After that, he went to Calcutta for higher education. At the age of twenty one, he passed the BSc Exam obtaining Honours in Chemistry, Physics and Math from the Presidency College, Calcutta. He took his MSc degree in Math in 1896.

The next year, he was appointed as an examiner of MA in Math in Calcutta University. Then, he passed BL Examination. Then he enrolled himself in the Calcutta High Court. He worked with Nawab Sir Salimullah. He played an important role in founding the All India Muslim League in 1906. Then, he became Deputy Magistrate. But he resigned and again joined Calcutta High Court. In 1913, he became an elected MLC. Three years after, he attended the special joint session of the Congress and the Muslim League in Lucknow. In 1918, he became the General Secretary of the Indian National Congress and the President of the All Indian Muslim League.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: The passage is about Abul Qashem Fazlul Huq who was the General Secretary of the Indian National Congress and the President of All India Muslim League. He was born in 1873 in Barishal. he received his primary education in a village Maktab. After passing the Entrance Examination with distinction, he obtained his BSc in 1894 and MSc in Match in 1896 from Presidency College, Calcutta. He started his career as an examiner of MA in Math in Calcutta University in 1897. He played an important role in founding All India Muslim League in 1906. Then, he re-joined the Calcutta High Court. He was an elected member of BLC and attended the special joint session of the Congress and the Muslim League.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'Your School Library' by answering the following questions.
(a) What is a school library? (b) Where is it situated? (c) What kinds of books are there in your school library?
(d) What is the use of your school library? (e) How can you borrow books from there? (f) What sorts of books do you borrow from the library?

sub_questions.explanation:
Our School Library

A library is the place where various kinds of books, newspapers, magazines, etc, are kept for readers. A school library is only for the teachers and the students of a school. We have an up-to-date library in our school. It is housed in a separate one-storey building. It is quite spacious and well-ventilated. The books are arranged systemically in different bookshelves. So, we have no difficulty in finding out the expected books. Our school library has a good collection of text and reference books. It has also books on different branches of knowledge like literature, history, science, commerce, geography, travels, biography and so on. Besides, it has a good supply of newspapers, magazines and journals. Moreover, there is a librarian in charge of our school library. He is well-trained, qualified and experienced. Every student has a library card. We can borrow two books at a time. Nobody is allowed to keep a book for more than two weeks. In the library; discipline and silence is strictly maintained. While studying in the reading room, students are strictly prohibited to talk or disturb others in any way. The calm and quiet atmosphere of the library helps the students to work attentively. Our school library plays an important role in enriching both our academic and general knowledge. It provides us with the opportunity to read different types of books. To us, it is a storehouse of knowledge. I think, every educational institution should have a library. To conclude it can be said that no educational institute is a complete one without a library.

Once there lived a poor rickshaw puller. He had to maintain his family consisting of six members with a great difficulty. He always thought of additional income for the maintenance of his family. One day while walking through the fields, he found a purse of gold dropped by a passer-by. He …..

sub_questions.explanation:
Honesty of a Rickshaw-puller
Once there lived a poor rickshaw puller. He had to maintain his family consisting of eight members with great difficulty. One day while walking through the fields, he found a purse dropped by a passer-by. He picked the purse up and found a.lot of money in it. He said, "It might be dropped by a passer-by." He looked for the owner for sometimes, but found no one. He took the bag to his home and showed it to his wife. His wife said to him, "God has given this money to us and so we should use it to remove our poor condition." The rickshaw puller said, "No, it does not belong to us. I should look for the owner." The next day, the rickshaw puller was waiting in that place where he
found the purse thinking that the owner might come in search of it. After a long time, he noticed a man looking for something. The rickshaw puller rushed to the man and came to know that the purse belonged to him. He took the man to his home and handed over the bág. The man was very pleased at the honesty of the rickshaw puller. The man was very rich and he gave the rickshaw puller a good job with high salary in his farm. The rickshaw puller and his family became pleased and they were no more in want.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Tanvir/Tanisa. You have a friend named Habib/Habiba who has breathing problem. Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about air pollution.

sub_questions.explanation:
Habiba:Hello, Tanisha. How are you?
Tanisha: I'm fine, thanks and you?
Habiba : I'm not so fine. I'm suffering from breathing difficulty.
Tanisha: Why? I found you well yesterday.
Habiba : Actually I'm coming from Uttara by bus. The smoke, dust of construction work have made it tough for me to breathe.
Tanisha : Air pollution! This is really a big problem for our country.
Habiba : What's the main cause of air pollution?
Tanisha : Smoke is the main cause.
Habiba: Can you explain how smoke is created?
Tanisha : Smoke is created in various ways.
Habiba : Like what?
Tanisha : People make fire to cook food, melt pitch for road construction, which generates smoke. Also, buses, trucks, and cars use petrol and diesel, which also create smoke.
Habiba : How is air pollution harmful to us?

Habiba: Yes, I-am trying my best. Thank you.

"Today there are many jobs where you need English. This is because the world has become smaller. Vast distances are shortened by speedy transports. We can talk to a person thousands of kilometres away on the phone or the Internet. So, we can communicate with the whole world easily. English has made this communication easier.

There are many countries in the world with many languages, but to communicate with them, you cannot use all the languages. So, you need a common language that you can use with more or less all the people in the world. English is that common language. You can talk to a Chinese toy maker, a French artist, an Arab ambassador or a Korean builder in one language - English.

English for us in Bangladesh is all the more important. As we have seen earlier, we are too many people in a small country. So, if you learn English, you have the best opportunity to find a good job, both within and outside the country. And that is good news for millions of our unemployed youths." "But Miss, we learn English for 12 or 14 years, yet we do not find good jobs", says Rumi. She then tells the class about what happened to her brother. "Could you please tell us why?" Rumi asks. "This is a very important question, Rumi: We should learn how to use English both orally and in writing for doing things as needed in our work, such as communicating with others at personal, social, national and international levels. But unfortunately, at the moment we are learning English mainly for our exams," continues Miss Choudhury. "Remember, English can greatly help you become skilled workers."
